headline: Sanwo-Olu announces 100% funding increase for LSETF

headline: ISWAP training suicide bombers to attack northeast-DSS

headline: S2PAfrica holds its 2022 Regional Engineering Design Competition(EDC) Awards Ceremony
summarized_story:

Dr Nadu Denloye, current Chair, ICT committee, the Nigerian Academy of Engineering (NAE), served as the chair for the Engineering design competition.
Team EASS won the Energy efficiency category prize of $500, while Team Capture won the Harnessing Ignored Energy category prize of $500.

summarized_story:

headline: Obaseki to partner FG to revitalize Okomu National Park, sends forestry bill to Edo Assembly – Nigerian Observer
summarized_story:
Share FacebookTwitterStumbleuponLinkedInPinterestThe Edo State Governor, Mr. Godwin Obaseki, has said his administration will partner the federal government on the management of the Okomu National Park, to revitalize the park and strengthen security in the area.
Obaseki disclosed this on Thursday while addressing the Conservator of the Okomu National Park, Mr. Augustine Obekpa, when he visited the park in Udo Community, Ovia South-West Local Government Area of the state.
He noted, “We are going to be sending a forestry bill to the Edo State House of Assembly for consideration next week.

headline: Ukraine: FG to pay $100 to returnees, 2 additional aircraft arriving today
summarized_story:

headline: Nestlé Nigeria grows revenue by 22.6% to N351.8bn in 2021
summarized_story:
Nestlé Nigeria Plc announced its financial results for the year 2021, posting a revenue of N351.8 billion recording 22.6% growth over the previous year.
Gross profit for the year stood at N 132.4 billion, compared to N 119.2 billion during the previous year.
The Company posted profit after tax of N 40.0 billion for the year.

headline: Russia-Ukraine War: Airlift Of Nigerians Rescheduled For Today
summarized_story:
The Airpeace Chartered flight that was scheduled to evacuate Nigerians from Poland to Abuja yesterday (Thursday) has been cancelled because the crew said they have gone beyond their duty limit.
About 2,090 Nigerians were set to be repatriated from Poland, Hungary, Romania and other Eastern European countries, following the war that erupted after the invasion of Ukraine by Russia about a week ago.
Speaking from Poland, Ambassador Bolaji Akinremi, who is leading the delegation for the evacuation said “the reality is that the flight has been scheduled for tomorrow (Friday) morning.
“They have a duty hour which has been allocated to them and they have waited from 9 till 2 pm.
That means they have already waited five hours and they are going to have a 9 hours flight that is already more than the standard.

summarized_story:

We need partners like you to achieve that,” he told the Meta team.
While appreciating the company’s support in broadband penetration, the NITDA DG added that there are other areas of collaborative efforts between NITDA and Meta, especially in digital literacy.

headline: JUST-IN: Pension Fund Assets Hit N13.6trn
summarized_story:
The nation’s pension fund assets rose significantly from N13.42trillion in December, 2021 to N13.61 trillion as at the end of January 2022, gaining N183.8 trillion within one month, LEADERSHIP learnt.
Available data sourced by LEADERSHIP shows that the fund opened last year (2021) at N12.29 trillion in January, but dropped to N12.24 trillion in February, following the drop in yield in the bonds market where the pension fund administrators have about 60 per cent of the pension fund invested.
The pension fund assets rose to N12.90 trillion in August, having gained N120 billion, while it pulled N101 billion gains in September, 2021 to stay at N13 trillion.
The latest data sourced from National Pension Commission (PenCom) shows that 9.55 million workers are now under the Contributory Pension Scheme (CPS) as at the end of January, 2022 even as investment in federal government securities gulped N8.35 trillion of the N13.61 trillion pension assets.
ADVERTISEMENTThe director general of PenCom, Mrs. Aisha Dahir-Umar, had said the growth in the pension fund assets under the new pension scheme, was an indication of prudent and sincere management of the pension fund by the pension operators and the regulator.According to her, “the maintenance of a consistent growth trajectory continues to justify the Commission’s overriding investment philosophy of ensuring the safety of pension fund assets.”To this end, the president, Pension Fund Operators Association of Nigeria (PenOp), Mr. Wale Odutola, had earlier noted that, operators are engaging market operators, the exchanges, the regulators, and international organisations to develop new and alternative products that pension funds can profitably invest in.

headline: Federal Govt Unveils New Approach To Tackle Adult Illiteracy
summarized_story:
The federal government has announced a new strategy in the war to eliminate illiteracy and its accompanying malaise among the more than 90 million adult population and about 13 million out-of-school children in the country.
The new system, according to Prof. Akpama, will be in addition to existing strategies, namely the Literacy-by-Radio (LBR), the Rural Facilitators’ Scheme (RFS), Each-One-Teach-One and other initiatives, all aimed at facilitating the attainment of the Commission’s mandate of eradicating illiteracy among Nigerians aged 15 years and above.
The Executive Secretary, while commending President Muhammadu Buhari and Education Minister, Adamu Adamu, for funding of the Adult and Non-Formal education sector, stated that LEEDS will form the antidote to poverty as it has been empirically proven that mere acquisition of basic and post-literacy skills devoid of economic empowerment tools aggravates poverty with its accompanying deleterious socio-economic consequences.
It can be recalled that the federal government recently unveiled a plan to educate about two million non-literate Nigerians annually to enable them uplift their status and enable them contribute to national development.
ADVERTISEMENTThe National Commission for Mass Literacy, Adult and Non-Formal Education was established by Act 17 of June 25, 1990, with a mandate to, among others things, provide basic education to the country’s non-literate adults and youths aged 15 and above through a non-formal approach.

headline: Bloody Friday: 30 killed by 2 suicide bombers in packed mosque
summarized_story:
Two suicide bombers have blown themselves up at a mosque in north-western Pakistan, killing 30 people and injuring scores of others, police and medics said.
The men fought their way inside the mosque compound in the city of Peshawar by killing police guards before blowing themselves in the packed main hall, police official Haroon Raheed said.
“At least 30 bodies and more than 60 injured people were brought to Lady Reading Hospital, the biggest health facility in the city.
“The death toll may rise as more than a dozen of those injured are in critical condition,” said the hospital spokesperson.
Rescuers, police and volunteers were searching the rubble for further victims, said rescue services official, Bilal Faizi.

headline: Arinola Aderibigbe loses gold worth N3.5M to bandits
summarized_story:
By Chidinma Ewunonu-AlukoA woman identified as Arinola Aderibigbe has lost gold and other items worth N3.5 million to some bandits in Ibadan Oyo state.
Amusan said the trio, armed with guns and other dangerous weapons, attacked Aderibigbe and dispossessed her of three sets of gold jewelry worth N3.5 million.
Two pairs of gold rings worth N800,000 were among the items stolen.
A Samsung IPDA X10 mobile phone worth N1.2 million was also stolen.
Amusan said the offences contravened sections 6 (B) and 1 (2) of the Robbery and Firearms Laws of Nigeria, 2004.

headline: Fire kills illegal petrol marketer, wife in Jos
summarized_story:
By Polycarp AutaOn-going fuel scarcity across the country has led to the death of an illegal petrol marketer and his wife in Jos.
The couple died on Thursday when a fire erupted from the kitchen where Mr Gideon Pam hoarded petrol at their residence in Zawan community of Jos South Local Government Area of Plateau.
An eye witness and neighbour, Miss Shantel Alphonsus, told the News Agency of Nigeria (NAN) that “Pam runs an illegal petrol business at Zawan Junction.
“His wife, Mercy, who had gone out earlier returned and saw smoke emitting from the house.
He expressed regret that the couple was burnt beyond recognition and the house razed before firemen could reach the scene.

headline: Davido sells out O2 Arena tickets: How to stream the concert
summarized_story:
Not even a single ticket is available for Davido’s concert at the O2 Arena on March 5 – The show is now sold out.
The O2 Arena is a multi-purpose indoor arena in the center of The O2 entertainment complex on the Greenwich Peninsula in southeast London.
The event center, which has a 20,000-sitting capacity, is the second-highest seating capacity of any indoor venue in the United Kingdom, behind the Manchester Arena.
This is not the first time Davido will be having a sold-out concert at the arena.
Davido sold out the event center in January 2019.

headline: Buhari has grossly failed North, Nigerians – Saraki
summarized_story:
Former Senate President and a two-term governor of Kwara State, Bukola Saraki says President Muhammadu Buhari has grossly failed Northern Nigeria and the country in general.
Saraki, whose Presidential Campaigns train visited Kano, Thursday night, said President Buhari promised to give Nigerians power but the country was now worse off in energy supply.
“The President said he will provide effective security of lives and properties, today, Nigerians cannot even travel to a closer town without being in fear and uncertain of what will happen to them,” he said.
“Bukola Saraki would certainly take over the government, organize massive reforms, restructure the mentality of Nigerians, bring back justice, because justice has been compromised by the APC regime, which does not respect separation of powers.
Bukola Saraki who is not corrupt would do the magic and wipe out our tears”.

headline: Abia: Gunmen Kill Former PDP Women Leader, Her Daughter And Two Others In Ohafia
summarized_story:
Abia: Gunmen Kill Former PDP Women Leader, Her Daughter And Two Others In OhafiaGunmen have killed a former PDP women leader, Madam Ucha Kalu Ndukwe and her first daughter, Chibuzor Ndukwe in Amangwu community in Ohafia Local Government Area of Abia State.
Two other persons identified as Ndubuisi Ndukwe and Kalu Umah were also killed in the attack which occurred on Tuesday, February 1.

Majority Leader, Rep. Alhassan Ado-Doguwa, and the Chairman, Committee on Foreign Affairs, Rep. Yusuf Buba, are currently with some Nigerian students in Romania.
The lawmakers visited Romania in preparation for the evacuation of Nigerians caught in the war between Russia and Ukraine.
The House of Representatives had passed a resolution that specifically asked the two lawmakers to urgently liaise with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the National Intelligence Agency, and the management of Air Peace to facilitate the commencement of the evacuation.
Some of the students are expected to arrive in Nigeria today.

headline: [Breaking] 2022 World Cup playoff: Eguavoen hands Lookman, Amoo first Super Eagles’ call up ahead Ghana clash *Standby Onazi returns as camp opens March 21, see full list
summarized_story:
Technical Adviser Augustine Eguavoen has called up Captain Ahmed Musa, deputy captain William Ekong, midfielder Wifred Ndidi and forwards Moses Simon and Kelechi Iheanacho in a Super Eagles’ provisional list of 32 for the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 play-off round against the Black Stars of Ghana.
Leicester City FC of England forward Ademola Lookman, recently cleared by FIFA to switch international allegiance and former U17 World Cup star Akinkunmi Amoo are officially called for the first time, while defender Calvin Bassey and forward Emmanuel Dennis return to the fold of the three –time African champions.

headline: Nigeria: NNPC Seeks to ‘Pre-empt Mobil on Asset Sale to Seplat’
summarized_story:
The Nigerian National Petroleum Company (NNPC) Limited may have created a wedge in the highly acclaimed transaction that would have seen Seplat Energy, an indigenous oil firm, buy over oil shares belonging to ExxonMobil, THISDAY has learnt.
The source stressed that NNPC did not have the power to halt the acquisition of the multinational oil company’s shares by Seplat.
Seplat Energy subsequently put forward a winning bid for the assets and reached an agreement with ExxonMobil.
The NNPC had recently announced a funding agreement with Afreximbank for up to $5 billion to grow its investment in new and existing upstream assets.
